main.*: Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes.

revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

[[Category:Player vs Monster]] __TOC__ ==Description== This is a list of some of the most commonly used tameable Monsters and animals as well as rare spawn tameables. The maintainers of this archive were ably assisted by many helpful tamers including Shortbus, Great Dragon, Suikoden, and many other adventurers! '''Note:''' The locations of the tameables, particularly the rarer spawns, may change at the whim of the UOForever Game Masters! The loremasters maintaining this archive will endeavour to ensure the information here is kept current. '''Warning:''' Certain tameables, such as Swamp Dragons, are very attractive targets for pet trappers who will try to lure your pets to their house to trap it. For more information please see the [[Protecting Your Pets]] page. ===Bonding=== Pet bonding is possible on UO Forever. This can be achieved through the normal means - feed once, wait a week, feed again. For the impatient, there is also a pet bonding deed which can be purchased from the [[Donation Coin]] vendors. A pet ball can also be purchased to link to your pet which then allows you to summon the pet in case you lose it deep in a dungeon. Be aware that some unfriendly folk like to lure pets - Be careful where you leave your pet and if it is valuable to you, be sure to get a pet ball! ===Control=== You can use the following form to calculate your chance to control your pet: {{PetControllCalculator}} ===Pack Instinct=== Some tameables across the world have the pack instinct ability. Having this affinity produces increased damage when used in a group of the same instinct. The current pack instinct categories are arachnid, bear, bull, canine, daemon, equine, feline, and ostard. The benefit you gain is for each pet in the pack it increases the damage bonus by 25%. This then caps at 300% damage increase, which is mainly possible with the Crab Meta pet via the brood relics. ==Taming Charts== There are 2 major divisions of Tameables; Pets and Mounts. Pets are non-mountable creatures that will come to your aid but must be able to either walk/fly to you or the target. When these Pets are unbonded, you will need to use the spell [[Gate Travel]] or physically lead them to an exit. You can use Donation Coins to purchase a Bonding Deed in order to instantly bond the creature which will then recall with you if the creature is set to follow or guard mode. Mounts are creatures that will allow you to ride them once they have been successfully tamed and are not currently poisoned. When a Mount is tamed, you may want to force it to stop attacking you with an "all stop" command, then mount the creature so you can recall out with it. Be careful if it is an aggressive creature, it may get flagged with a criminal status if it continues to attack you in town once you dismount to stable the creature! It is advised to either ride the creature for 120 seconds, or take it to a home or place out of guards reach while the original criminal timer wears off. Mounts commonly die in town and are lost forever if they have guards called on them and are still retaining this criminal status, however if you use [[Donation_Coin|Donation Coin]] bought Bonding Deeds, the pet will become a resurrectable target after it has been killed in town. ===Pet Taming Chart=== {| class="wikitable" ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Pet ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Minimum Taming Requirement ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Minimum Transfer Requirement ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Follower Slots ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Category ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Location ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Max Stats |- |

|- |} ==Giant Beetle== ===Regular=== [[File:giantbeetle.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 50+ ** '''To Transfer:''' 0 * '''Location:''' [[Spider Cave]] * '''Follower Slots:''' 3 * '''Max Stats:''' 150 STR/ 166 HP / 50 DEX / 250 INT (This is an example, Max Stats are not known) A crafter's best friend - These friendly beetles act as a rideable pack animal. Great for resource gathering and generally moving heavy loads around without the frustration and risk of dragging a pack horse around with you. The beetles have a chance to spawn in the Spider Cave. While they do not require a particularly high level of taming, you may need to look out for the other malicious spawn in the Spider Cave. ===Rare Hue=== [[File:raregiantbeetle.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 120 * '''Location:''' Fire inbetween Shadow Balron and Normal Balron * '''Follower Slots:''' 3 * '''Spawn:''' Speculated to be Monthly * '''Max Stats:''' 150 STR/ 166 HP / 50 DEX / 250 INT (This is an example, Max Stats are not known) This rare hue of giant beetle seems to spawn with griefers and trolls who will try their best to ruin your chance of taming it. Even without the griefers and trolls, it is a hard task to tame these elusive creatures. Be prepared for a long taming session! ==Battle Chicken== [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Preview.png|thumb|Only some of the various colors that Battle Chickens can come in!]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 0.9 ** '''To Transfer:''' 0 * '''Location:''' Forests, Jungles, Towns... these can spawn wherever chickens normally spawn. You can also find them near Chicken coops that can be found in [[Moonglow]], [[Yew]], [[Ocllo]], [[Skara_Brae|Skara Brae]], and [[Jhelom]]. * '''Follower Slots:''' 1 * '''Max Stats:''' 5 HP / 100 STAM / 100 MANA / 100 STR / 100 DEX / 100 INT / 2 AR
100 [[Wrestling]], [[Tactics]], [[Anatomy]] These rare but beautiful birds come in many, many colors and spawn wherever chickens spawn. These were introduced for the infamous Chicken Fights which has been seen on the server since 2013! They come higher stats than a normal chicken and can train to GM skills in [[Wrestling]], [[Tactics]], [[Anatomy]]. They also [[Controlling_Pets#Bonding|instantly bond]] when fed a grain item(such as a loaf of bread), this is to allow quick training attempts as they only have 5 HP. It is recommended for training that you [[Bless_Spell|Bless]] these chickens to keep their life bars at a reasonable level to use their GM skills. [[File:Tameables_Chicken_Fights_Ad.png|thumb|An example of one of the famous Chicken Fights Night.]] ===Battle Chicken Colors=== There are various colors that have been seen throughout the lands, and brave adventurers are still gathering up information on the possible colors that can be found in the wild: {| class="wikitable sortable" ! align="center" | '''Preview''' ! align="center" | '''Hue Color''' ! align="center" | '''Hue Name''' |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Aquamarine.png]] | align="center" | 1785 | align="center" | Aquamarine |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Frosted_Pink.png]] | align="center" | 1793 | align="center" | Frosted Pink |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Bloodstained.png]] | align="center" | 2673 | align="center" | Blood Stained |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Blue.png]] | align="center" | 93 | align="center" | Blue |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Halcyon_Gold.png]] | align="center" | 2180 | align="center" | Halcyon Gold |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Green.png]] | align="center" | 2963 | align="center" | Jade |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Gold.png]] | align="center" | 2721 | align="center" | Lord British Gold |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Purple.png]] | align="center" | ??? | align="center" | Purple |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Mica.png]] | align="center" | 1170 | align="center" | Mica |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Orange.png]] | align="center" | 44 | align="center" | Orange |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Pink.png]] | align="center" | ??? | align="center" | Pink |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Red.png]] | align="center" | ??? | align="center" | Red |- | align="center" | [[File:Tameables_Battle_Chickens_Red_Blue.png]] | align="center" | 1172 | align="center" | Red Blue |} ==Drake== [[File:drakegrey.gif|right]] * '''Required Taming:''' 84.3 * '''Location:''' [[Destard]], Fire Temple, & Temple Island * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Max Stats:''' 430 STR, 430 HP, 152 DEX, 140 INT As with dragons, drakes come in the classic red and grey shades. Within the drake family you will also find a blue version known as "a pathaleo drake" and white version known, unsurprisingly named "a white drake" which is often, surprisingly, not white! Drakes are rarely used by tamers as they have low overall stats and even new tamers are best of using a Young Dragon rather than a Drake. ==Young Dragon== [[File:youngdragonred.gif|right]] * '''Required Taming:''' 73.9 * '''Location:''' Destard, Fire Temple & Temple Island * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Max Stats:''' 550 STR, 550 HP, 105 Dex, 475 INT A useful ally for a training tamer. While not as powerful as a fully grown Dragon, these younglings can still pack a powerful punch considering their relatively low taming requirement. They spawn with normal Dragon red and grey, a range of greens and other several other hues. ==Dragon== [[File:DragonNEthy.PNG|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 93.9 * '''Location:''' [[Destard]], Fire Temple and Temple Island * '''Follower Slots:''' 3 * '''Spawn:''' Constant! * '''Max Stats:''' 825 STR, 825 HP, 105 DEX, 475 INT The classic trusty dragon, every young tamer's favourite monster bashing companion. As well as the traditional red hue shown, these can also spawn in classic grey, various shades of green and occasionally ethereal (Also shown here). Watch out for the fire breath while trying to tame one! ==Dragon (Rideable)== * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' Unknown * '''Location:''' Unknown * '''Follower Slots:''' Unknown * '''Spawn:''' Unknown * '''Max Stats:''' Unknown While dragons are certainly large enough to support an adventurer on their backs, they are naturally designed to lift with their claws and leave plenty of wingspan room for their impressive wing muscles. However, once in a while, you may find yourself in the presence of a dragon fit for riding. These dragons not only need to be trained for the addition of you and your gear on their backs, but you also need to be trained to be on the dragons back as well! There are rumors of those that seek to mount a dragon can read about how-to in [[Dragon_Mastery|ancient scrolls of knowledge]]. [[File:RideableDragon.png]] ==White Wyrm== [[File:whitewyrm.png|right]] * '''Taming Required''' ** '''To Tame:''' 96.3 ** '''To Transfer:''' ? * '''Location:''' Ice Dungeon * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' * '''Max Stats:''' 760 STR, 760 HP, 130 DEX, 425 INT White Wyrms lack a dragon's fire breathing ability but they make up for this with a high-level of [[Magery]]. They are also known be slightly more temperamental than dragons and may not always listen to your commands. They can spawn in a few different hues, including a pure white, a "dirty" white and ice blue. ==Water Dragon== [[File:waterdragon.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 93.9 ** '''To Transfer:''' ? * '''Location:''' East of Dagger Isle in ocean * '''Follower Slots:''' 3 * '''Spawn:''' Timer * '''Max Stats:''' 825 STR, 825 HP, 105 DEX, 475 INT The dragon of the high seas. These mighty beasts have the same power as a dragon but they can also fly over water making them popular amongst fisherman and pirates. ==Deep Water Dragon== [[File:deepwaterdragon.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 96.3 ** '''To Transfer:''' ? * '''Location:''' Northeast of Amoeba Island in ocean * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' Timer * '''Max Stats:''' 760 STR, 760 HP, 130 DEX, 425 INT The white wyrm of the oceans. These winged creatures have the same power as a white wyrm but they can also fly over water. A valuable asset for anyone wishing to pursue [[Message_in_a_Bottle|MIBs]], [[Whirlpool|Whirlpools]] and other adventures at sea. ==Phoenix Wrym== * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' ? ** '''To Transfer:''' ? * '''Location:''' [[Ankh]] * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' ? * '''Max Stats:''' ? STR, ? HP, ? DEX, ? INT One of three new Wrymms added as a tameable. Each have their own special abilities that make them shine ahead of the Ice Wrymm we are familiar with. The Phoenix Wrymm has an AOE blast that radiates out and back in, it is possible to damage targets twice. [[File:PhoenixWrymm.gif]] ==Alara Wrym== * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' ? ** '''To Transfer:''' ? * '''Location:''' [[Ankh]] * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' ? * '''Approximate Stats:''' 744 STR, 789 HP, 131 DEX, 522 INT One of three new Wrymms added as a tameable. Each have their own special abilities that make them shine ahead of the Ice Wrymm tameables we are familiar with. The Alara Wrymm creates a impassable AOE blast that surrounds in a circle radius from where it landed. Over time this blast of ice will thaw making it possible to move again. Players are still able to teleport outside of the impassable zone. [[File:AlaraWrym.gif]] ==Hellkite Wrym== * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' ? ** '''To Transfer:''' ? * '''Location:''' [[Ankh]] * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' ? * '''Approximate Stats:''' 818 STR, 827 HP, 118 DEX, 422 INT One of three new Wrymms added as a tameable. Each have their own special abilities that make them shine ahead of the Ice Wrymm we are familiar with. The Hellkite Wrymm creates many miniture fires around the blast radius, any enemy that walks over these flame patches will be damage similar to the fire field spell. [[File:HellkiteWrym.gif]] ==Death Beetle== [[File:deathbeetle.png|right]] * '''Taming Required''' ** '''To Tame:''' 115 ** '''To Transfer:''' 105 (110 to bond naturally) * '''Location:''' [[Ice_Dungeon#Level_3|Ice Dungeon]] Level 3 * '''Follower Slots:''' 3 * '''Spawns:''' Every 24 hours * '''Max Stats:''' 513 STR, 930 HP, 190 DEX, 540 INT For those not wishing to pursue the costly [[Meta Pets]], the death beetle is an excellent pet to have in any tamer's pet arsenal. The beetle's high level of poisoning can make it significantly easier to take down some big ugly monsters. ==Giant Ice Worm== [[File:Gianticeworm.png|right]] * '''Taming Required''' ** '''To Tame:''' ??? ** '''To Transfer:''' ??? * '''Location:''' Green Thorns Snow Zones * '''Follower Slots:''' 1 * '''Spawns:''' With Green Thorns * '''Max Stats:''' 117 STR, 111 HP, 49 DEX, 40 INT These unique tamble pets provide you a 1 slot pet that can apply higher level poison on hit, also in glacial hue! ==Unicorn== [[File:unicorn.gif|right]] ===Casting=== * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 95 * '''Location - Casting:''' [[Ankh]] Unicorn Lair * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' 3 Days * '''Stats:''' 350 STR, 350 HP, 115 DEX, 225 INT ===Non Casting=== * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 95 * '''Location:''' Mage Tower in Hedge Maze * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' Frequent * '''Stats:''' 37 STR, 63 HP, 69 DEX, 9 INT (This is an example, Max Stats are not known) The unicorn, the most fabulous of all mounts, spawn commonly as non-casters that can be ridden by anyone. There are however rarer spawns which are significantly more fabulous and intelligent that have the ability to cast. The casting version also has the ability to sense when its owner is in danger and will occasionally cast a heal or cure on the owner. The two types can be easily distinguished by their stats. The non-casting version has similar stats to a regular horse. The casting unicorns can only be ridden by female tamers. ==Kirin== ===Casting=== [[File:kirin.gif|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 95 ** '''To Transfer:''' 95 * '''Location:''' ? * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' ? * '''Stats:''' 318 STR/ 346 HP / 90 DEX / 212 INT (This is an example, Max Stats are not known) ===Non Casting=== * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' ? ** '''To Transfer:''' 0 * '''Location:''' ? * '''Follower Slots:''' ? * '''Spawn:''' ? * '''Stats:''' 37 STR, 63 HP, 69 DEX, 9 INT (This is an example, Max Stats are not known) One is a horse in disguise, the other is a tamer's combat ally. The casting kirins can only be ridden by male tamers and are known to cast an area of effect attack similar to chain lightning when the owner's health is low. ==Rare White Horse== [[File:whitehorse.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' ? ** '''To Transfer:''' 100 * '''Location:''' [[Ice Dungeon]] * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' ? * '''Max Stats:''' 400 STR, 400 HP, 125 DEX, 300 INT ==Rare Holiday Steed== [[File:HolidaySteeds.PNG|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' ? ** '''To Transfer:''' 100 * '''Location:''' Holiday Dungeon * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' Christmas Holiday Dungeon * '''Max Stats:''' 400 STR, 400 HP, 125 DEX, 300 INT ==Skeletal Steed== [[File:Skeletalsteed.png|right]] * '''Required Taming:''' 120 * '''Location:''' Ice Dungeon level 3 * '''Follower Slots:''' 1 * '''Spawn:''' Every 7 days * '''Max Stats:''' 37 STR, 63 HP, 69 DEX, 9 INT (This is an example, Max Stats are not known) == Swamp Dragon== [[image:swampdragon.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 110+ ** '''To Transfer:''' 0 * '''Location:''' [[Booty Island]] * '''Follower Slots:''' 1 * '''Spawn:''' Has a chance to spawn after killing a silver serpent. * '''Max Stats:''' ?? It may take over 110 taming to tame a Swamp Dragon but anyone can control and ride it once tamed. They can be armoured with a dragon barding deed crafted with [[Blacksmithing]]. This armor reduces all damage dealt to the rider by 18% for any metal. Exceptionally crafted armor gives another 2% for a total max of 20%. The Swamp Dragon starts out as a creature called a Chaos Dragoon or Chaos Dragoon Elite, a humanoid riding the Swamp Dragon. Once the Chaos Dragoon is killed and knocked off, the Swamp Dragon can then be tamed. The Elite version is appropriately named and will take some beating! ==Rideable Wolf== [[File:Rideablewolfplain.gif|right]][[File:purewhitewolf.gif|right]][[File:WolfColors.jpg|50px|right|Hues]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' ~45 ** '''To Transfer:''' 0 * '''Location:''' Yew Orc Fort * '''Follower Slots:''' 1 * '''Max Stats:''' ?? These friendly pups, a favourite amongst the orcs, can be ridden by anyone. They are not useful as offensive pets but are sometimes used as a fashion statement. They spawn in a range of hues, including several metallic ones such as copper, agapite and valorite. The rarest spawning hue is ultra white (hue# 2498) - This version popular amongst the West Britain Bank fashionistas. Thanks to Ryker Core for providing a complete list of wolf hues. ==Rideable Polar Bear== [[File:rideablepolarbear.gif|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 75.1 * '''Location:''' In a snow cave in the North West corner for Dagger Isle * '''Follower Slots:''' 1 * '''Spawn:''' Frequent * '''Stats:''' 126 STR / 123 HP / 103 DEX / 48 INT Much like the rideable wolf, these cuddly bears are not offensive pets. There are no known rare hues. These are not to be confused with night bears which require a high-level of taming. ==Rare Rideable Polar Bear== [[File:RareRideablePolar.PNG|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' ? * '''Location:''' ? * '''Follower Slots:''' 1 * '''Spawn:''' ? * '''Stats:''' ? Much like the rideable polar bear, but this comes in a rare hue. ==Night Pets== Become a night rider with this array of night pets! All Night Pets breath fire and much like a dragon, the damage is related to the Current Hit Points of the Night Pets, more HP means more damage! Notes: * All Night Pets are similar in strength to the classic Nightmare, however the non-Nightmare Night Pets can be found occasionally exceeding the normal Max Stats listed. * Any Night Pet(Nightmares included) can be trained to a maximum of 100 Points in Dexterity and/or Intelligence, so if you find a Night Pet with low Dex or Int you can train it up to 100! ===Nightmare=== [[File:nightmareLong.png|right]][[File:nightmareShort.png|right]] *'''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 95.1 ** '''To Transfer:''' 95.1 * '''Location:''' [[Fire Dungeon]] level, 1 [[Champion_Spawns#The_Harrower|Star Room]] (rare), [[Terathan Keep]] and [[Ankh]] * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' Varies depending on location! A rare ethereal version is said to occasionally spawn in [[Ankh]]. * '''Max Stats:''' 525 STR, 525 HP, 105 DEX, 125 INT The nightmare is a powerful equine that can act as a formidable weapon against monsters and as a graceful steed for a skilled tamer. As well as kick, biting and casting, the nightmare also has the firebreath ability. The damage of firebreath is based on the nightmare's current health points. ===Nightbear=== [[File:nightbear1109.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 116 ** '''To Transfer:''' 95.1 * '''Location:''' [[Covetous]] 5 & Orc Fort * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' ? * '''Max Stats:''' 525 STR, 525 HP, 105 DEX, 125 INT ===Nightfrenzy=== [[File:nightfrenzy.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 116 ** '''To Transfer:''' 96 * '''Location:''' Skull Island * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' Every 6-7 days * '''Max Stats:''' 525 STR, 525 HP, 105 DEX, 125 INT ===Nightridge=== [[File:nightridge.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 116 ** '''To Transfer:''' 96 * '''Location:''' [[Terathan Keep]] * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' Every 6-7 days * '''Max Stats:''' 525 STR, 525 HP, 105 DEX, 125 INT ===Nightwolf=== [[File:nightwolf.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 116 ** '''To Transfer:''' 96 * '''Location:''' [[Khaldun]] * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' Every 6-7 days * '''Max Stats:''' 525 STR, 525 HP, 105 DEX, 125 INT ===Nightllama=== [[File:nightllama.png|right]] * '''Required Taming''' ** '''To Tame:''' 116 ** '''To Transfer:''' 96 * '''Location:''' [[Buccaneer%27s_Den|Buccaneer's Den]] Tunnels * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' Every 6-7 days * '''Max Stats:''' 525 STR, 525 HP, 105 DEX, 125 INT ===Nightdragon=== [[File:nightdragon.png|right]] * '''Required Taming:''' 116 * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' '''No longer spawns!''' * '''Max Stats:''' 525 STR, 525 HP, 105 DEX, 125 INT ==Avian Steed== [[File:AvianSteeds2.PNG|right]] * '''Required Taming:''' 105.7 * '''Location:''' [[Montor]], [[Grinch%27s_Grotto]] and [[Asylum]] * '''Follower Slots:''' 2 * '''Spawn:''' Has a built in timer for the locations that it spawns. * '''Max Stats:''' 1197 STR, 1108 HP, 130 DEX, 10 INT '''Information is still being collected about this mysterious creature.''' This mount has a couple spawns around the world and has a percentage chance to spawn as multiple rare, beautiful colors if you are lucky to come across one. While it is high in strength and hit points it is not very intelligent so it is unable to cast magic. ==Contributors== The community would like to thank the following brave adventurers who contributed their time and experiences for others to enjoy: * Bo * Dyzzery * Khan o Megas * Tarek * Teto
